a reality distortion field that may have made enemies but also bestowed an ineffable cool on his entire company. Larry, by all accounts, makes Eric Schmidt look like Steve Jobs . Ken Auletta explains: He is a very private man, who often in meetings looks down at his hand-held Android device, who is not a comfortable public speaker, who hates to have a regimented schedule, who thinks it is an inefficient use of his time to invest too much of it in meetings with journalists or analysts or governments. As C.E.O., the private man will have to become more public. Google's engineer-driven approach to new products has been a long-standing problem.( Google Wave, anybody?) Unlike Apple, it seems to build for engineers and developers, not consumers. That's great when
